definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while

sentences.english: Chapter Three: This chapter is focused on the comparison between Chinese Xiehouyu and Korean corresponding proverbs.
sentences.chinese: 第三章主要考察歇後語在韓國語中的對應關係。

sentences.english: The paper studies how to translate Chinese allegorical sayings into English with the principles of equivalence as a guideline.
sentences.chinese: 本文從等效翻譯的角度來探討漢語歇後語的翻譯。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to have no sense of shame/brazen
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
to get straight to the point (idiom)
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
